summary: schistosome Trichobilharzia regenti spends part of its intravertebrate period of life within the central nervous system. migration of the parasites can beaccompanied by neuromotor disorders or paralysis in natural definitive hosts (ducks) and even in laboratory mammals. several antigens originating in cercariae and schistosomula were recognized by IgY with diverse sensitivity and specificity. four of them were considered as the most promising candidates for immunodiagnostics.
